sigma_analysis_results.rule_title: Use Short Name Path in Command Line
sigma_analysis_results.rule_description: Detect use of the Windows 8.3 short name. Which could be used as a method to avoid command-line detection

sigma_analysis_results.rule_title: Usage Of Web Request Commands And Cmdlets - ScriptBlock
sigma_analysis_results.rule_description: Detects the use of various web request commands with commandline tools and Windows PowerShell cmdlets (including aliases) via PowerShell scriptblock logs
Detects requests to exclude files, folders or processes from Antivirus scanning using PowerShell cmdlets
Detects modification of autostart extensibility point (ASEP) in registry.
sigma_analysis_results.rule_author: Victor Sergeev, Daniil Yugoslavskiy, Gleb Sukhodolskiy, Timur Zinniatullin, oscd.community, Tim Shelton, frack113 (split)

sigma_analysis_results.rule_title: Use Short Name Path in Image
sigma_analysis_results.rule_description: Detect use of the Windows 8.3 short name. Which could be used as a method to avoid Image detection

sigma_analysis_results.rule_title: Potential Binary Or Script Dropper Via PowerShell
sigma_analysis_results.rule_description: Detects PowerShell creating a binary executable or a script file.
Detects the creation of the "PSScriptPolicyTest" PowerShell script by an uncommon process. This file is usually generated by Microsoft Powershell to test against Applocker.
Detects suspicious ways to download files or content using PowerShell

sigma_analysis_results.rule_description: Detects the creation of scheduled tasks by user accounts via the "schtasks" utility.

match_context.values: @{Product=Microsoft\xae Windows\xae Operating System; CurrentDirectory=C:\Users\Bruno\Desktop\; OriginalFileName=schtasks.exe; Hashes=MD5=478BEAEC1C3A9417272BC8964ADD1CEE,SHA256=9A121ACF7686D2883E524332111D5E4BCC0C1A8E81136486FBA4CA65CA614407,IMPHASH=918DBB01101BFA7F1042CCA9520D2A05; Description=Task Scheduler Configuration Tool; FileVersion=10.0.19041.906 (WinBuild.160101.0800); ParentCommandLine=C:\Windows\system32\cmd.exe /c schtasks /create /tn lZRn5ma9EtO /tr "mshta C:\Users\Bruno\AppData\Local\Temp\umZ6cPKAi.hta" /sc minute /mo 25 /ru "Bruno" /f; CommandLine=schtasks  /create /tn lZRn5ma9EtO /tr "mshta C:\Users\Bruno\AppData\Local\Temp\umZ6cPKAi.hta" /sc minute /mo 25 /ru "Bruno" /f; EventID=1; ParentImage=C:\Windows\SysWOW64\cmd.exe; IntegrityLevel=High; Image=C:\Windows\SysWOW64\schtasks.exe; Company=Microsoft Corporation}

@{Hashes=SHA1=BBE6394229CE3A53ECCD2CB4CEA6EE41134EFDA9,MD5=15FF7D8324231381BAD48A052F85DF04,SHA256=7949EDDF437FED5F45564402B26E4D457EA666D1361A7C4F07D830BE233A4F72,IMPHASH=FC93D9248DEA161B2E724C188AECD07D; CurrentDirectory=C:\Users\george\Desktop\; OriginalFileName=schtasks.exe; Product=Microsoft\xae Windows\xae Operating System; Description=Task Scheduler Configuration Tool; EventID=1; ParentCommandLine=C:\Windows\system32\cmd.exe /c schtasks /create /tn OnSS9maeTc0 /tr "mshta C:\Users\george\AppData\Local\Temp\CSshOjiJi.hta" /sc minute /mo 25 /ru "george" /f; CommandLine=schtasks  /create /tn OnSS9maeTc0 /tr "mshta C:\Users\george\AppData\Local\Temp\CSshOjiJi.hta" /sc minute /mo 25 /ru "george" /f; FileVersion=10.0.17134.1 (WinBuild.160101.0800); ParentImage=C:\Windows\SysWOW64\cmd.exe; IntegrityLevel=High; Image=C:\Windows\SysWOW64\schtasks.exe; Company=Microsoft Corporation}

attributes.magic: PE32 executable (GUI) Intel 80386, for MS Windows

threat_severity.level_description: Severity HIGH because it was considered trojan. Other contributing factor was that it could not be run in sandboxes.

crowdsourced_yara_results.description: Identifies compiled AutoIT script (as EXE). This rule by itself does NOT necessarily mean the detected file is malicious.
crowdsourced_yara_results.author: @bartblaze

crowdsourced_ids_results.rule_category: Malware Command and Control Activity Detected
crowdsourced_ids_results.rule_raw: alert http $EXTERNAL_NET any -> $HOME_NET any (msg:"ET MALWARE Amadey CnC Response"; flow:established,to_client; http.response_body; bsize:<9; content:"|20 3c|c|3e|"; startswith; fast_pattern; content:"|3c|d|3e|"; within:4; pcre:"/^\x20\x3cc\x3e\d?\x3cd\x3e$/"; reference:url,x.com/Jane_0sint/status/1902465896897040658; reference:md5,35d4ace09132aab814e1424c8645533f; classtype:command-and-control; sid:2060969; rev:1; metadata:affected_product Windows_XP_Vista_7_8_10_Server_32_64_Bit, attack_target Client_Endpoint, tls_state plaintext, created_at 2025_03_20, deployment Perimeter, malware_family Amadey, confidence Medium, signature_severity Critical, updated_at 2025_03_20, mitre_tactic_id TA0011, mitre_tactic_name Command_And_Control, mitre_technique_id T1071, mitre_technique_name Application_Layer_Protocol; target:src_ip;)

alert tcp $HOME_NET any -> $EXTERNAL_NET $HTTP_PORTS ( msg:"MALWARE-CNC Win.Trojan.GozNym variant outbound connection"; flow:to_server,established; http_raw_uri; bufferlen:16<=>21; http_uri; content:"/index.php",offset 7; http_client_body; content:"|3D|",depth 8; http_header; content:!"Accept"; content:!"Referer"; http_uri; pcre:"/\/(?=[a-z0-9]*[0-9])(?=[a-z0-9]*[a-z])[a-z0-9]{5,10}\/index\.php/"; metadata:impact_flag red; service:http; reference:url,www.virustotal.com/en/file/55f9cd6cbed53ccc26d6d570807a18f91d9d8c10db352524df424f356d305a6e/analysis/; classtype:trojan-activity; sid:38638; rev:3; )

crowdsourced_ids_results.rule_msg: POLICY-OTHER HTTP request by IPv4 address attempt
crowdsourced_ids_results.rule_raw: alert tcp any any -> any $HTTP_PORTS ( msg:"POLICY-OTHER HTTP request by IPv4 address attempt"; flow:to_server,established; http_header; content:"Host:",fast_pattern,nocase; pcre:"/^Host\x3a\s*(?:(?:25[0-5]|2[0-4][0-9]|[01]?[0-9]?[0-9])\.){3}(?:25[0-5]|2[0-4][0-9]|[01]?[0-9]?[0-9])\s*:?\s*\d*\s*$/ims"; service:http; reference:url,www.w3.org/Protocols/rfc2616/rfc2616-sec15.html; classtype:policy-violation; sid:50447; rev:1; )

crowdsourced_ids_results.rule_msg: ET INFO Executable Download from dotted-quad Host
crowdsourced_ids_results.rule_raw: alert http $HOME_NET any -> $EXTERNAL_NET any (msg:"ET INFO Executable Download from dotted-quad Host"; flow:established,to_server; http.uri; content:".exe"; endswith; nocase; http.host; content:"."; offset:1; depth:3; content:"."; within:4; content:"."; within:4; pcre:"/^(?:\d{1,3}\.){3}\d{1,3}$/"; http.request_line; content:".exe HTTP/1."; fast_pattern; classtype:bad-unknown; sid:2016141; rev:9; metadata:attack_target Client_and_Server, created_at 2013_01_03, deployment Perimeter, performance_impact Significant, confidence High, signature_severity Informational, updated_at 2024_04_09;)

crowdsourced_ids_results.rule_msg: ET INFO Executable Retrieved With Minimal HTTP Headers - Potential Second Stage Download
crowdsourced_ids_results.rule_raw: alert http $EXTERNAL_NET any -> $HOME_NET any (msg:"ET INFO Executable Retrieved With Minimal HTTP Headers - Potential Second Stage Download"; flowbits:isset,min.gethttp; flow:established,to_client; file_data; content:"MZ"; within:2; content:"PE|00 00|"; distance:0; classtype:bad-unknown; sid:2016538; rev:3; metadata:created_at 2013_03_06, confidence High, signature_severity Informational, updated_at 2019_07_26;)

crowdsourced_ids_results.rule_msg: ET HUNTING SUSPICIOUS Dotted Quad Host MZ Response
crowdsourced_ids_results.rule_raw: alert http $EXTERNAL_NET any -> $HOME_NET any (msg:"ET HUNTING SUSPICIOUS Dotted Quad Host MZ Response"; flow:established,to_client; flowbits:isset,http.dottedquadhost; file_data; content:"MZ"; within:2; content:"PE|00 00|"; distance:0; classtype:bad-unknown; sid:2021076; rev:2; metadata:created_at 2015_05_08, confidence Medium, signature_severity Informational, updated_at 2019_07_26;)

alert ip any any -> any any (msg:"TGI HUNT netsh advfirewall"; flow:established; content:"netsh advfirewall"; content:!"This example shows  how to disable Wmi fixed port"; distance:-730; within: 50; content:!"from administrator command prompt window"; distance:22; within:45; threshold:type limit, track by_src, seconds 60, count 1; classtype:bad-unknown; sid:2610332; rev:1;)
